intro: Conobea pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf conobea, is a small, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with hairy, narrow leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
